thread.title: KTM launches 200 Duke, 250 Duke and 390 Duke in India, starts at Rs 1.43 lakh
thread.title_full: KTM launches 200 Duke, 250 Duke and 390 Duke in India, starts at Rs 1.43 lakh - The Financial Express

author: FE Online
title: KTM launches 200 Duke, 250 Duke and 390 Duke in India, starts at Rs 1.43 lakh
text:
KTM India has launched the 200 Duke, the new 250 Duke and 390 Duke in India. The 2017 KTM 200 Duke is priced at Rs 1.43 lakh, the new 250 Duke carries a price tag of Rs 1.73 lakh and the refreshed 390 Duke cost Rs 2.25 lakh. All the prices are ex-showroom, Delhi.
KTM 200 Duke
The 2017 KTM 200 Duke is powered by a BS-IV (Bharat Stage-4) compliant 199.5cc water-cooled, single-cylinder, four-stroke engine that develops 26 hp of power which has been marginally increased over the previous model. The engine is mated to a 6-speed transmission. The naked motorcycle uses a lightweight steel trellis frames, new three-chamber silencer and has a fuel tank capacity of 11 litre. With a dry weight of 129.5 kg, the company claims that the 200 Duke has an unbeatable power-to-weight ratio. The three-chamber silencer on the motorcycle is positioned close to the body's centre of gravity which helps in improved handling. It uses regulated catalytic converter to improved emission norms.
The 2017 KTM 200 Duke is powered by a 199.5cc water-cooled, single-cylinder, four-stroke engine that develops 26 hp of power. The 200 Duke also features multi-function digital instrument console that provides information about the fuel consumption, gear position, clock, etc. The 800 mm two-piece seats on the new 200 Duke are claimed to be good for long-distance riding and comfortable for both, rider and pillion. Other highlights of the new 200 Duke include 43 mm upside-down telescopic fork at the front by WP suspension pin-jointed swing-arm at the rear axle and lightweight 17-inch cast light alloy wheels fitted with a 110 mm tyre at the front and 150 mm at the rear. The company has also offered the motorcycle with ABS.
The company also offers the motorcycle with redesigned headlamp with halogen light and LED DRLs (Daytime Running Lamps). The ignition key slot has been placed on the fuel tank which was earlier seen on the instrument console. The motorcycle is available in three colour options, orange wheels and new graphics. The 2017 KTM 200 Duke rivals against the Bajaj Pulsar RS 200 and the TVS Apache RTR 200 in the segment.
KTM 250 Duke
KTM has expanded its Duke range in India by launching the 250 cc, KTM 250 Duke priced at Rs 1.73 lakh, ex-showroom, Delhi. The design of the new naked motorcycle is based on the KTM 1290 Super Duke R and the 390 Duke, but it is powered by a 250 cc liquid cooled, single-cylinder engine. The engine produces 28 hp of power and 24 Nm of torque and is mated to a 6-speed transmission with slipper clutch similar to the 2017 390 Duke. The exhaust of the 250 Duke features a link pipe and silencer. The 250 Duke also shares its features such as side-slung exhaust, open-cartridge USD suspension and steel fuel tank of 13.5 litre.
The new 250 Duke also gets a host of features such as an LCD instrument console similar to the 200 Duke For effective braking, the company has equipped the 250 Duke with a 300 mm disc at the front and a 200mm disc at the rear with ABS. The new Duke also gets a host of features such as an LCD instrument console similar to the 200 Duke that provides information like fuel quantity, speed, tachometer, clock, trip meter, service reminder, shift light. The new 250 Duke is offered with a choice of two body colours - orange and white. The new 250 Duke will compete with the Honda CBR 250R, Yamaha FZ25 and the Kawasaki Z250.
Watch: 2017 KTM Duke 390 Official Video:
KTM 390 Duke
The 2017 390 Duke too shares its design with the 1290 Super Duke R and has received a host of new features as compared to the previous model. One of the major updates on the new KTM 390 Duke is the coloured TFT instrument cluster with smartphone compatibility through the handlebar, first in the segment. The motorcycle will also feature a new split headlamp with 20 LEDs and redesigned split seats.
The 2017 KTM 390 Duke is equipped with TFT instrument cluster with smartphone compatibility, which is first in the segment. The 390 Duke is powered by the same BS-IV compliant 373.2 cc single-cylinder, 4-stroke engine that produces 43.5 hp of power and 37 Nm of torque, and is paired to a 6-speed transmission with slipper clutch and Ride-By-Wire technology. The company has increased the torque of the motorcycle by 2 Nm.
The 390 Duke is also built on a lightweight dual-coloured split steel trellis frame for improved handling and manoeuvrability. The motorcycle also features adjustable lever as per the riders glove and for better grip. KTM has also equipped the 2017 model with upside down (USD) from WP suspension that uses open-cartridge technology, which according to the company is easy to maintain. There are also lightweight 17-inch cast light alloy wheels wrapped with Metzeler tyres.
Also Read: New 2017 KTM 200 Duke, 390 Duke and 250 Duke launched, price, specs, features and design
The KTM 390 Duke also gets a rear mounted 2-channel Bosch ABS (Anti-lock Braking System) along with conventional side-mounted upswept exhaust as well as redesigned front fender. The two-wheeler maker has also increased the fuel tank capacity to 13.5 litre, which was 11 litre on the previous model. The 2017 KTM 390 Duke competes with the likes of the Bajaj Dominar 400.
